definitions: material composed of antiparticles having opposite charge to ordinary matter particles
examples: Scientists created antimatter in the particle accelerator experiment
Antimatter annihilates when it contacts regular matter releasing energy

definitions: agent that kills microorganisms or stops their growth and reproduction
examples: The hospital uses antimicrobial soap to prevent infections
Silver has natural antimicrobial properties that inhibit bacterial growth

definitions: compound that inhibits oxidation and neutralizes harmful free radicals in cells
examples: Blueberries contain powerful antioxidants that protect against cell damage
Vitamin C acts as an antioxidant in the human body

definitions: deep-seated feeling of dislike or aversion toward someone or something
examples: She felt strong antipathy toward her dishonest colleague
His antipathy for modern art was evident in his reviews

definitions: person who studies or collects ancient objects and historical artifacts
relating to the study of ancient times and old valuable objects
examples: The antiquarian spent decades building his collection of Roman coins
She visited the antiquarian bookshop searching for first editions
The museum hired an antiquarian expert to authenticate the artifacts
Antiquarian societies preserve knowledge about local historical traditions

definitions: person who studies or collects antiques and artifacts from past times
examples: The local antiquary identified the pottery shards as medieval
As an antiquary, he specialized in ancient manuscripts and documents

definitions: collectible object valued for its age, beauty, rarity, or historical significance
examples: The antique vase dated back to the Ming dynasty
She inherited several antiques from her grandmother's estate collection

definitions: ancient past, especially the period before the Middle Ages in Europe
object, building, or work of art from ancient times having historical value
examples: Scholars study antiquity to understand early human civilizations better
The museum displayed artifacts from Greek and Roman antiquity
The bronze statue was a genuine antiquity from ancient Egypt
Art dealers authenticated the antiquity before the auction sale

definitions: prejudice, discrimination, or hostility directed against Jewish people as a religious or ethnic group
examples: The organization works to combat antisemitism through education programs
Historical antisemitism led to persecution and violence against Jewish communities

definitions: substance that prevents infection by inhibiting the growth of disease-causing microorganisms
examples: The nurse cleaned the wound with antiseptic before bandaging
Iodine is a common antiseptic used in medical procedures

definitions: medication or substance used to treat viral infections by inhibiting virus reproduction
examples: The doctor prescribed an antiviral to treat the flu symptoms
Researchers are developing new antivirals for emerging viral diseases

definitions: branched horn grown annually by male deer, elk, and related animals
examples: The stag's antlers had twelve points showing his maturity
Deer shed their antlers every year and grow new ones

definitions: heavy iron block on which metals are hammered and shaped by blacksmiths
examples: The blacksmith placed the hot iron on the anvil
The rhythmic sound of hammer striking anvil filled the workshop

definitions: member of Native American peoples originally from southwestern United States regions
widely-used open-source web server software for hosting websites and applications
examples: The Apache nation has preserved their cultural traditions for generations
Apache warriors were known for their skilled horseback riding abilities
Our company website runs on Apache server for reliable performance
The developer configured Apache to handle increased web traffic

definitions: former policy of racial segregation and discrimination enforced in South Africa from 1948 to 1994
examples: Nelson Mandela fought against apartheid throughout his life courageously
The apartheid system denied basic rights to non-white South Africans

definitions: absence of emotion, enthusiasm, or concern about things that others find important
examples: Voter apathy resulted in low turnout for the election
His apathy toward his studies worried his parents greatly

definitions: large primate without a tail, including gorillas, chimpanzees, orangutans, and gibbons
examples: The zoo's new ape exhibit features endangered mountain gorillas
Scientists study apes to understand human evolutionary origins better

definitions: opening, hole, or gap through which light passes, especially in optical instruments
examples: The photographer adjusted the camera's aperture for better exposure
Light entered the cave through a small aperture in the ceiling

definitions: top or highest point of something, especially forming a peak or culmination
examples: The mountaineer finally reached the apex after days of climbing
Her career reached its apex when she became company president

definitions: tiny soft-bodied insect that feeds on plant sap and damages crops
examples: Gardeners use ladybugs to control aphid populations naturally
The roses were infested with aphids sucking their vital fluids

definitions: brief statement expressing a general truth or observation about life in memorable form
examples: Benjamin Franklin wrote many aphorisms like 'time is money'
The philosopher's aphorisms were quoted in countless graduation speeches

definitions: food, drink, or drug thought to stimulate sexual desire or enhance performance
examples: Some cultures consider oysters to be a natural aphrodisiac
The ancient Greeks named aphrodisiacs after their goddess Aphrodite

definitions: self-confidence and assurance, especially in demanding or difficult situations
examples: She handled the hostile questions with remarkable aplomb
The diplomat maintained his aplomb during the tense negotiations

definitions: temporary cessation of breathing, especially during sleep, requiring medical attention
examples: Sleep apnea causes dangerous pauses in breathing at night
The doctor recommended a breathing device to treat his apnea

definitions: complete final destruction of the world as described in religious texts
event involving destruction or damage on an awesome or catastrophic scale
examples: Many religions describe an apocalypse at the end of time
The book of Revelation details the Christian apocalypse prophecy
Climate scientists warn of an environmental apocalypse without action
The nuclear war would bring about a global apocalypse

definitions: point in orbit where object is farthest from Earth or another body
highest point in development or achievement of something
examples: The satellite reaches apogee at 35,786 kilometers above Earth
The moon's apogee occurs about two weeks after perigee
The empire reached its apogee during the fifth century
Her artistic career hit its apogee with the retrospective exhibition

definitions: formal written defense or justification of one's opinions, position, or conduct
examples: The politician published an apologia explaining his controversial decisions
His memoir served as an apologia for his business practices

definitions: person who offers arguments in defense or justification of something controversial
examples: She became an apologist for the new educational reform policies
Critics dismissed him as merely an apologist for corporate interests

definitions: abandonment or renunciation of religious faith, political party, or cause
examples: His apostasy from the church shocked his religious family members
The senator's apostasy from party principles cost him political support

definitions: person who renounces religious faith, political belief, or principles they once held
examples: The apostate faced persecution after leaving the religious community
Former party members were branded apostates by loyalist factions

definitions: each of twelve disciples chosen by Jesus Christ to spread his teachings
passionate advocate or pioneering supporter of a particular cause or reform
examples: Saint Paul became an apostle after his conversion experience
The twelve apostles spread Christianity throughout the ancient world
She was an apostle of educational reform in rural areas
The scientist became an apostle for renewable energy solutions

definitions: punctuation mark (') indicating possession, omission of letters, or plural forms
examples: The apostrophe in "can't" shows the omission of letters
Students often confuse apostrophes in "its" and "it's" usage

definitions: historical term for person who prepared and sold medicines and drugs
examples: The village apothecary mixed herbal remedies for common ailments
Medieval apothecaries kept detailed records of their medicinal preparations

definitions: complex equipment or machinery designed for a particular scientific or technical purpose
complex structure or system of an organization, especially political or administrative
examples: The laboratory apparatus included microscopes and centrifuges for research
Firefighters checked their breathing apparatus before entering the building
The government apparatus struggled to implement the new policies effectively
The party's propaganda apparatus spread their message through multiple channels

definitions: clothing, especially of a particular type or for a specific occasion
examples: The store specializes in outdoor apparel for hiking enthusiasts
Athletes wore official team apparel during the awards ceremony

definitions: supernatural appearance of a ghost, spirit, or strange figure
examples: Witnesses claimed to see an apparition in the haunted mansion
The apparition vanished as suddenly as it had appeared

definitions: process or instance of coming into sight or becoming visible
examples: The suspect's appearing in court was delayed by weather
Her sudden appearing at the party surprised all the guests

definitions: diplomatic policy of making concessions to avoid conflict with aggressive powers
examples: Critics argued that appeasement only encouraged more aggressive demands
The policy of appeasement failed to prevent the outbreak of war

definitions: person who appeals to a higher court against a lower court's decision
examples: The appellant argued that the trial court made procedural errors
Both appellant and respondent presented their cases to the judges

definitions: identifying name or title given to a person, place, or thing
examples: The wine carried a prestigious appellation from Bordeaux region
She earned the appellation 'Iron Lady' through her tough leadership

definitions: projecting part of an organism typically smaller than the main body
examples: The octopus uses each appendage to explore its underwater environment
Insects have six appendages that they use for walking

definitions: surgical procedure to remove the appendix, usually due to inflammation or infection
examples: The emergency appendectomy saved her from a ruptured appendix
Recovery from an appendectomy typically takes several weeks of rest

definitions: section of additional information at the end of a book or document
small tube-shaped organ attached to the large intestine in humans
examples: The research paper's appendix contained all the raw data tables
Check the appendix for a complete list of references cited
Doctors removed his inflamed appendix before it could burst dangerously
The appendix may have served digestive functions in human ancestors

definitions: natural physical desire for food when hungry or at mealtimes
strong desire or inclination for a particular activity or experience
examples: The long hike gave everyone a healthy appetite for dinner
Illness can cause a complete loss of appetite in patients
She had an insatiable appetite for adventure and travel
The investor showed little appetite for high-risk ventures lately

definitions: small dish of food served before the main course of a meal
examples: The restaurant offers complimentary appetizers while you wait for dinner
We ordered several appetizers to share among the whole table

definitions: sound of people clapping hands repeatedly to show approval or praise
examples: The audience burst into thunderous applause after the performance
She acknowledged the applause with a graceful bow on stage
